meanings.definition: To send (letters, packages, etc.) again or back to the original recipient.
meanings.sent1: She remails the lost package to the customer.
meanings.sent2: He always remails important documents to ensure they arrive safely.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful postman remails the letters he misplaced.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness remails in the hearts of those she helps.
meanings.sent5: The echo of her laughter remails in the empty room.

meanings.definition: The act of sending something again or back to the original recipient.
meanings.sent1: The remails of the returned letters were carefully sorted.
meanings.sent2: She received multiple remails of the same magazine issue.
meanings.sent3: The office had a pile of remails waiting to be processed.
meanings.sent4: The remails from the post office arrived later than expected.
meanings.sent5: The remails from the lost package were finally located.
